macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Major Stock Indexes See Slight Declines on Friday Amid Holiday Trading
items.summary: The S&P 500 closed down 2.11 points (0.03%) at 6,929.94, Dow Jones down 20.19 points (0.04%) at 48,710.97, Nasdaq down 20.21 points (0.09%) at 23,593.10, and Russell 2000 down 0.5% at 2,534.35, following weekly gains of 1.4%, 1.2%, 1.2%, and 0.2% respectively.

items.title: S&P 500 and Dow Hit Record Highs During Weekly Santa Claus Rally
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose 1.4% for the week to new record highs, Dow up 1.2% also reaching records, driven by tech, financials, and materials sectors amid light holiday volumes.

items.title: Spot Silver Surges 10% to Over $79 per Ounce, Gold Up 1.12%
items.summary: Silver jumped 10% amid supply constraints, reaching over $79/oz, while gold rose to $4,531.1; precious metals led materials sector gains as inflation hedges.

items.title: Target Shares Rise on Activist Investor Stake News
items.summary: Target stock advanced following reports of an activist investor acquiring a stake, contributing to modest gains in consumer sectors during thin trading.

items.title: US Crude Oil Prices Fall 2.8% as Markets Remain Closed for Holidays
items.summary: Crude oil declined 2.8% while Treasury yields stayed steady; most global markets including Asia and Europe had no trading on Saturday.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: XRP price chatter intensifies after renewed institutional demand and ETF inflows
items.summary: Analysts note parallels between XRP's late‑2025 price action and its 2017 breakout as ETF inflows and regulatory clarity (including the SEC settlement with Ripple earlier in 2025) have boosted institutional demand, prompting debate about whether XRP could see another large December rally.

items.title: Tom Lee says Ethereum could reach $7,000–$9,000 in early 2026
items.summary: Market strategist Tom Lee forecasted that Ethereum's price may rise to $7,000–$9,000 by early 2026, citing accelerating tokenization of assets and increased on‑chain financial activity as tailwinds for ETH demand.

items.title: Solana reported as top public blockchain by 2025 revenue
items.summary: CryptoRank data cited by Phemex shows Solana leading public blockchain revenue in 2025 with approximately $1.3 billion, ahead of Hyperliquid, Tron and Ethereum—a notable development in protocol-level revenue rankings.

items.title: Privacy coins gain amid European regulatory tightening; Vitalik critiques 'no space' vision
items.summary: Privacy‑focused tokens have outperformed many sectors in 2025 as Europe’s MiCA enforcement and other regulatory measures push capital toward privacy solutions; Ethereum co‑founder Vitalik Buterin publicly challenged what he called a restrictive European approach to digital‑asset privacy.

items.title: Crypto IPO wave: Circle, Bullish, eToro go public; Kraken files for $20B listing
items.summary: Market watchers report a renewed IPO surge in crypto with Circle, Bullish and eToro pursuing public listings and Kraken filing for a roughly $20 billion IPO—signalling increased Wall Street interest and institutionalization of crypto firms.

items.title: Crypto retail interest dips to one-year low in Google search trends
items.summary: Google search interest for crypto has fallen to a one‑year low, indicating reduced retail attention even as institutional flows and protocol developments continue to shape markets.

items.title: Geopolitical shock: Venezuela oil blockade coincides with asset shifts including tokenized gold interest
items.summary: Reporting notes that geopolitical disruptions tied to a Venezuela oil blockade have coincided with surging gold prices and may be shifting some market flows toward tokenized gold and impacting crypto trading patterns amid heightened volatility.

items.title: Community event: Shiba Inu 'LC Unwrapped' talk hosted by LBank
items.summary: An LBank event scheduled for 28 December will feature Shiba Inu ecosystem representatives discussing upcoming plans for LC SHIB and related ecosystem developments, signalling ongoing active community engagement for meme/utility tokens.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Nokia and Nvidia announce $1B partnership to co-develop AI‑driven 6G radio access networks
items.summary: Nokia and Nvidia revealed a $1 billion strategic investment and collaboration to build AI‑driven Radio Access Network (AI‑RAN) technologies aimed at autonomous, energy‑efficient 6G networks with real‑time resource allocation and predictive maintenance, positioning networks to operate as cognitive systems rather than only infrastructure for connectivity.

items.title: Survey of late‑2025 AI research highlights GPT‑5, agentic AI, neuromorphic hardware and quantum‑AI convergence
items.summary: An educational roundup of recent AI research emphasizes progress on foundation models (including GPT‑5), agentic/agents research, neuromorphic hardware advances, and early demonstrations suggesting quantum processors could accelerate ML tasks—pointing to growing interest in hybrid classical–quantum AI systems.

items.title: Debate continues on AI’s cognitive and social impacts as studies report reduced engagement from heavy ChatGPT use
items.summary: Media coverage reviewing 2025 studies (including work from MIT’s Media Lab) reports that heavy use of conversational AI like ChatGPT can reduce cognitive engagement and recall in tasks such as essay writing, and is associated in some studies with increased feelings of loneliness—fueling discussions about productivity gains versus potential cognitive atrophy.
items.source: Al Ahram / reporting on MIT studies

items.title: Thought leadership: Andrej Karpathy warns programmers must rethink mental models for AI systems
items.summary: Andrej Karpathy argues that developers need new mental models to work with stochastic, brittle, and evolving AI systems and emphasizes learning to 'communicate' with AI (prompting, context control) as a core developer skill going forward.

items.title: Cultural coverage: debates over AI’s role in creativity, education and job exposure continue into year‑end
items.summary: End‑of‑year journalism reflects tensions between AI’s efficiency gains in creative and knowledge work and concerns about skill erosion, fairness, and job transformation—citing studies and industry analyses that estimate substantial portions of jobs are exposed to generative AI automation.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
